</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA6638 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6639 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	You should read the following discussion together with &#8220;Selected Financial Data,&#8221; and the historical financial statements and related notes included in this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K. The statements in this discussion regarding industry outlook, our expectations regarding our future performance, liquidity and capital resources and other non-historical statements in this discussion are forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements are subject to numerous risks and uncertainties, including, but not limited to, the risks and uncertainties described in &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; and &#8220;Forward-Looking Statements&#8221; included in this report. Our actual results may differ materially from those contained in or implied by any forward-looking statements.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6640 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6641 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Our fiscal year ends on the Monday nearest to December&nbsp;31 of each year. Fiscal years 2015, 2014 and 2013 were all 52-week years. References to fiscal years 2015, 2014 and 2013 are references to fiscal years ended December 28, 2015, December 29, 2014 and December&nbsp;30, 2013, respectively.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4921.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4921 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4921 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4921 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	35
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4921 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4921.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6654 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6655 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6656 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Ignite Restaurant Group,&nbsp;Inc. operates two restaurant brands in the casual dining segment, Joe&#8217;s Crab Shack (&#8220;Joe&#8217;s&#8221;) and Brick House Tavern&nbsp;+&nbsp;Tap (&#8220;Brick House&#8221;). Each of our restaurant brands offers a variety of high-quality food in a distinctive, casual, high-energy atmosphere. Joe&#8217;s and Brick House operate in a diverse set of markets across the United States and internationally. As of December&nbsp;28, 2015, we operated 130 Joe&#8217;s and 23 Brick House restaurants in 32 states. In October 2015, our first franchise and our first international location for Joe&#8217;s opened&nbsp;in Dubai, U.A.E. On April 17, 2015, we completed the sale of Romano&#8217;s Macaroni Grill (&#8220;Macaroni Grill&#8221;). See Note 3 in our Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements for further information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6657 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6658 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Joe&#8217;s is an established, national chain of casual dining seafood restaurants. Joe&#8217;s serves a variety of high-quality seafood items, with an emphasis on crab. Joe&#8217;s is a high-energy, family-friendly restaurant that encourages guests to &#8220;roll up your sleeves and crack into some crab.&#8221; Brick House is a casual restaurant brand that provides guests an elevated experience appropriate for every day usage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6659 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6660 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In fiscal year 2015, we opened two new Brick House restaurants, both of which were conversions from Macaroni Grill restaurants. We also closed nine Joe&#8217;s restaurants during 2015, of which three will be converted to Brick Houses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6661 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6662 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Outlook
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6663 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6664 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our near term business strategy focuses on increasing comparable restaurant sales at Joe&#8217;s and Brick House and continuing the growth of Brick House through new unit development.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6665 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6666 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We have experienced a decline in the operating performance at Joe&#8217;s. During fiscal year 2015, the comparable restaurant sales of Joe&#8217;s declined by 4.5% which contributed to a $4.3 million decrease in income from operations from the prior year, excluding the $9.4 million and $1.8 million non-cash impairment charge in 2015 and 2014, respectively. The decline in comparable restaurant sales is partially due to concentrated development in the Northeast region that is currently experiencing declining sales. The 16 stores opened in the Northeast during 2011 to 2013 accounted for 37% of the current year comparable sales decline but only represent 12% of the comparable store base. We have also begun experiencing sales declines in other geographic regions primarily due to decreased guest traffic. In order to reverse these negative trends, we have initiated a renewed focus to improve operational and menu execution in order to enhance the food quality and overall dining experience for the guest. We have also initiated new weekday value promotions including all-you-can-eat crab on Wednesdays that have positively impacted both sales and guest traffic. We will continue to evaluate our menu offerings and look for other weekday value offerings that could increase sales and traffic.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6667 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6668 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We have also started experiencing declines in operating performance at Brick House. During fiscal year 2015, the comparable restaurant sales of Brick House increased by 1.0%, however, we began experiencing declining same-store sales during the back half of the year. We believe much of the decline is due to changes that were made to the duration of our happy hour promotional period in the prior year. In order to reverse the sale trend, we have reverted back to the previous promotional period. We are also continuing to evaluate our menu to ensure we are offering items that are consistent with the expectations of our guests. Despite the decline in comparable restaurant sales during the back half of the year, income from operations at Brick House increased by $1.7 million during the current year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6669 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6670 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Additional declines in the operating performance at Joe&#8217;s or Brick House could cause us to close or sell more underperforming restaurants which may require us to recognize additional asset impairment or closure-related expenses and increase our valuation allowance during 2016 against some or all of our deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6671 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6672 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We target opening as many as four new restaurants in fiscal year 2016, including three conversions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4922.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4922 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4922 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4922 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	36
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4922 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4922.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6684 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Recent Developments
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6685 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6686 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Sale of Macaroni Grill
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6687 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6688 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On April 17, 2015, we completed the sale of Macaroni Grill for $7.3 million, net of directly related selling expenses, of which $7.1 million was received as of December 28, 2015. During the thirteen weeks ended March 30, 2015, we recorded a $22.4 million impairment charge to write down the net assets of Macaroni Grill to their estimated fair value less cost to sell, which is included in loss from discontinued operations in our condensed consolidated statements of operations. In addition, during the thirteen weeks ended June 29, 2015, we recorded a $6.1 million loss on disposal of the Macaroni Grill business in loss from discontinued operations. We used the net proceeds from the sale primarily for new restaurant development.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6689 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6690 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We believe that our exit from the Macaroni Grill business was a strategic shift which has a significant effect on our operations and financial results. Hence, we considered Macaroni Grill as a discontinued operation. As of December 29, 2014, the assets and associated liabilities of Macaroni Grill have been reclassified as discontinued operations. The operating results of Macaroni Grill for the current and prior periods have been aggregated and reclassified as discontinued operations in our consolidated statements of operations for fiscal years 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6692 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6691 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Asset Impairment
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6693 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6694 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We evaluate the recoverability of the carrying amount of long-lived assets, which include property and equipment and intangible assets, whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying value may not be fully recoverable. Due to continued declines in operating performance at certain Joe&#8217;s restaurants during the third and fourth quarters of 2015, we recorded impairment charges of $3.9 million and $5.5 million, respectively, related to Joe&#8217;s long-lived assets. During the third quarter of 2014, we recorded a $1.8 million impairment charge related to Joe&#8217;s long-lived assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6695 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6696 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Valuation Allowance
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6697 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6698 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We evaluate our deferred tax assets on a quarterly basis to determine whether a valuation allowance is required. We assess whether a valuation allowance should be established based on our determination of whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. The ultimate realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income during the periods in which those temporary differences become deductible and prior to the expiration of our credit carryforwards which begin to expire in 2031. We consider the scheduled reversal of deferred tax liabilities, projected future taxable income, and tax planning strategies in making this assessment. Due to continued operating losses and the asset impairments recorded during 2015 and 2014, we are in a three-year cumulative loss position. According to ASC Topic No. 740,
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
	, cumulative losses in recent years represent significant negative evidence in considering whether deferred tax assets are realizable. Therefore, during fiscal year 2015 and 2014, we recorded a valuation allowance of $12.8 million and $25.6 million for continuing operations and $6.8 million and $10.3 million for discontinued operations, respectively, against our deferred tax assets. We excluded the deferred tax liabilities related to certain indefinite lived intangibles when calculating the amount of valuation allowance needed as these liabilities cannot be considered as a source of income when determining the realizability of the net deferred tax assets. The valuation allowance was recorded as a reduction to our income tax benefit in our consolidated statement of operations.&nbsp;If we are able to&nbsp;generate sufficient taxable income in the future such that&nbsp;it becomes more likely than not that we will be able&nbsp;to fully utilize the net deferred tax assets on which a valuation allowance was recorded, our effective tax rate may decrease&nbsp;if the valuation allowance is reversed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6699 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6700 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Key Performance Indicators
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6701 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6702 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In assessing the performance of our business, we consider a variety of performance and financial measures. The key measures for determining how our business is performing are comparable restaurant sales growth, average weekly sales, restaurant operating weeks, average check, average unit volume and number of restaurant openings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4923.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4923 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4923 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4923 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	37
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4923 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4923.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6710 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Comparable Restaurant Sales Growth
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6711 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6712 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Comparable restaurant sales growth reflects the change in year-over-year sales for the comparable restaurant base. We define the comparable restaurant base to include those restaurants open for at least 104&nbsp;weeks, or approximately 24&nbsp;months. As of December 28, 2015, December 29, 2014 and December&nbsp;30, 2013, there were 147, 142 and 130&nbsp;restaurants, respectively, in our comparable restaurant base. Comparable restaurant sales growth can be generated by an increase in guest counts and/or by increases in the average check amount resulting from a shift in menu mix and/or increase in price. This measure highlights performance of existing restaurants as the impact of new restaurant openings is excluded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6713 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6714 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Average Weekly Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6715 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6716 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Average weekly sales is a key measure of individual restaurant economic performance of new and existing restaurants. Average weekly sales reflects total sales of all restaurants divided by restaurant operating weeks (see below). This measure is subject to seasonality for periods less than one year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6717 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6718 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Restaurant Operating Weeks
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6719 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6720 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Restaurant operating weeks is the aggregate number of weeks that our restaurants are in operation over a specific period of time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6721 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6722 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Average Check
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6723 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6724 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Average check is calculated for Joe&#8217;s by dividing net sales by guest counts for a given time period. Management uses this indicator to analyze the dollars spent in our Joe&#8217;s restaurants per guest. This measure aids management in identifying trends in guest preferences, as well as the effectiveness of menu price increases and other menu changes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6725 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6726 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Guest counts represent the estimated number of guests served in our restaurants. The count is estimated based on the number of entr&#233;es sold. Our estimates may vary from actual guest counts due to the variability in the level of sharing of certain entr&#233;e items on our menu. Given the significant level of alcohol sales and appetizer sales at Brick House, guest count is more difficult to quantify and therefore, we do not currently calculate average check as a key performance indicator for that brand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6727 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6728 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Average Unit Volume
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6729 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6730 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Average unit volume represents the average sales for restaurants included in the comparable restaurant base for a given time period, typically annually. Average unit volume reflects total sales for restaurants in our comparable restaurant base divided by the number of restaurants in our comparable restaurant base. This measure is subject to seasonality for periods less than one year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6731 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6732 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Number of Restaurant Openings
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6733 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6734 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Number of restaurant openings reflects the number of restaurants opened or converted during a particular reporting period. Before we open new restaurants or convert existing restaurants, we incur pre-opening costs. Typically, new restaurants open with an initial start-up period of higher than normalized sales volumes, which subsequently decrease to stabilized levels. While sales volumes are generally higher during the initial opening period, new restaurants typically experience normal inefficiencies in the form of higher cost of sales, labor and other direct operating expenses for several months and as a result, restaurant operating margins are generally lower during the start-up period of operation. The number and timing of restaurant openings has had, and is expected to continue to have, an impact on our results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4924.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4924 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4924 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4924 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	38
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4924 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4924.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>

<P ID=PARA6736 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Results of Operations
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6737 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6738 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The following table presents the consolidated statement of operations for the past three fiscal years expressed as a percentage of revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

</P>

</TD>
<TD ID=TBL8940.FINROW.3.AMT.2 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">

</TD>
<TD ID=TBL8940.FINROW.3.TRAIL.2 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" NOWRAP>
<P ID=PARA8858 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

	%
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD ID=TBL8940.FINROW.3.LEAD.3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ID=TBL8940.FINROW.3.SYMB.3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ID=TBL8940.FINROW.3.AMT.3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 12%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
	100.0
</TD>
<TD ID=TBL8940.FINROW.3.TRAIL.3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" NOWRAP>
<P ID=PARA8860 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	%
</FONT>

</TD>
<TD ID=TBL9017.FINROW.24.TRAIL.4 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" NOWRAP>
	)
</TD>
</TR>
<TR ID=TBL9017.FINROW.25 STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 55%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-LEFT: 9PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<P ID=PARA9009 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<P ID=PARA4926.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">

	&nbsp;

<DIV ID=PGBK4926 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4926 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4926 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	39
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4926 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4926.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6762 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Fiscal Year 2015 (52 Weeks) Compared to Fiscal Year 2014 (52 Weeks)
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6763 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6764 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6765 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6766 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenues were $492.0&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2015, a decrease of $11.5&nbsp;million, or 2.3%, compared to revenues of $503.5&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2014. The decrease is primarily due to a decrease of 3.9% in comparable restaurant sales, partially offset by higher operating weeks caused by the timing of restaurant opening and closure activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6767 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6768 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenues at Joe&#8217;s decreased 4.3% to $414.3&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2015 compared to $433.0&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2014. The decrease is primarily caused by a 4.5% decrease in comparable restaurant sales. The comparable restaurant sales decrease is comprised of 5.1% decrease in guest count and a 1.0% decrease in mix, partially offset by a 1.6% increase in pricing. Joe&#8217;s average weekly sales decreased to $59&nbsp;thousand from $61&nbsp;thousand in the prior year. Restaurant operating weeks decreased to 7,058 in 2015 from 7,107 in 2014 due to restaurant closures. We believe the decline in comparable restaurant sales is primarily due to a decrease in guest traffic and continued sales declines at restaurants in the Northeast region.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6769 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6770 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Brick House revenues increased 10.2% to $77.7&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2015 versus $70.5&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2014. The increase was the result of a 1.0% increase in comparable restaurant sales and new restaurant openings. The comparable restaurant sales increase is comprised of a 2.8% increase in pricing, partially offset by a 1.8% decrease in combined guest count and mix benefits. Brick House&#8217;s average weekly sales were at $66&nbsp;thousand for both fiscal years 2015 and 2014. Restaurant operating weeks increased to 1,176 in 2015 from 1,062 in 2014 due to new restaurant openings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6771 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6772 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Costs of Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6773 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6774 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Cost of sales decreased by $9.1 million, or 5.6%, to $154.3 million in 2015 versus $163.4 million in 2014 mainly due to the decrease in sales volume. As a percent of revenue, cost of sales decreased to 31.4% from 32.5% primarily due to improvement in seafood pricing at Joe&#8217;s and reduced discounting at Brick House.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6775 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6776 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Labor Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6777 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6778 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Labor expenses decreased by $0.5 million, or 0.3%, to $142.2 million in 2015 versus $142.7 million in 2014. The decrease is mainly due to lower restaurant management bonuses caused by lower sales, partially offset by decreased productivity in hourly labor at Joe&#8217;s. As a percent of revenue, labor expenses increased to 28.9% in fiscal year 2015 from 28.3% in fiscal year 2014 due to decreased productivity, increases in minimum wage, and deleverage from lower sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6779 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6780 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Occupancy Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6781 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6782 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Occupancy expenses increased by $1.5 million, or 3.8%, to $40.9 million in 2015 compared to $39.4 million in 2014. The increase is primarily caused by the increase in operating weeks. As a percentage of revenue, occupancy expenses increased to 8.3% from 7.8% primarily due to deleveraging of fixed rent expense from the decrease in comparable restaurant sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6783 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6784 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Other Operating Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6785 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6786 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Other operating expenses increased by $1.3 million, or 1.4%, to $95.4 million in 2015 versus $94.1 million in 2014. This is mainly due to increased insurance costs and building expenses, partially offset by lower credit card fees attributable to lower sales in the current year. As a percent of revenue, other operating expenses increased to 19.4% in 2015 from 18.7% in 2014 due to increased insurance costs and deleverage from lower sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4927.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4927 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4927 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4927 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	40
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4927 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA6790 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6791 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	General and Administrative
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6792 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6793 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	General and administrative expenses decreased by $8.1&nbsp;million, or 21.1%, to $30.5 million in 2015 compared to $38.7 million in 2014. As a percent of revenue, excluding the items mentioned above, general and administrative expenses decreased to 6.2% in fiscal year 2015 from 7.6% in fiscal year 2014 due to reduction of professional fees and personnel costs, partially offset by an increase of $1.7 million in severance costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6794 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6795 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Depreciation and Amortization
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6796 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6797 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Depreciation and amortization expense increased by $1.9&nbsp;million, or 8.1%, to $25.8 million in 2015 versus $23.9 million in 2014. This increase is primarily due to a higher depreciable base from newly opened restaurants and accelerated depreciation on closed restaurants. As a percentage of revenue, depreciation and amortization increased to 5.2% in fiscal year 2015 from 4.7% in fiscal year 2014 due to deleveraging from negative same-store sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6798 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6799 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Pre-Opening Costs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6800 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6801 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Pre-opening costs decreased by $1.9&nbsp;million, or 66.9%, to $0.9 million in 2015 from $2.8 million in 2014. This decrease is mainly due to the timing of scheduled restaurant openings. We opened two converted restaurants in 2015 and opened four new restaurants, including one conversion, in 2014. We also incurred pre-opening costs in both years for restaurants opened in the subsequent fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6802 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6803 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Asset Impairments and Closures
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6804 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6805 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Asset impairments and closures increased to $10.5&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2015 from $2.0&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2014. The $8.5 million increase is mainly due to the impairment charges on long-lived assets of $9.4&nbsp;million and $1.8 million in 2015 and 2014, respectively. We also closed nine restaurants in the current year versus none in the prior year. The closure-related expenses for fiscal year 2015 were primarily comprised of future minimum lease obligations. If we are unable to improve the performance of our restaurants or if we experience deteriorating results at some of our restaurants, we could recognize additional impairment charges.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6806 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6807 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Loss (Gain) on Disposal of Assets
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6808 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6809 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Loss on disposal of assets decreased by $1.5&nbsp;million, or 109.0%, to a $0.1 million gain in fiscal year 2015 from a $1.3 million loss in fiscal year 2014. The gain in fiscal year 2015 included a $2.0 million net gain on restaurants sold, offset by the impact of writing off $0.6 million in book value of replaced restaurant equipment and facilities improvements, and $1.3 million in asset retirement losses for closed, converted and remodeled restaurants. The loss in fiscal year 2014 was primarily from the impact of writing off the book value of replaced restaurant equipment and facilities improvements offset by any related sales proceeds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6810 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6811 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Income (Loss) from Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6812 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6813 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As a result of the foregoing, consolidated loss from operations increased by $3.6 million, or 76.6%, to $8.4 million in fiscal year 2015 from $4.7 million in fiscal year 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6814 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6815 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Joe&#8217;s income from operations decreased by $11.9 million, or 55.5%, to $9.5 million in fiscal year 2015 from $21.5 million in fiscal year 2014. As a percent of revenue, excluding the impact of non-cash impairment charges, pre-opening costs, severance and other costs related to conversions, remodels and closures, income from operations for Joe&#8217;s decreased to 5.2% in the current year from 5.9% in the prior year. This decrease is primarily attributable to lower comparable restaurant sales and deleveraging of fixed costs against lower sales volume, partially offset by improvement in seafood pricing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4928.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4928 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4928 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4928 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	41
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4928 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA6825 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6827 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Income from operations for Brick House increased by $1.7 million, or 44.7%, to $5.5 million in fiscal year 2015 from $3.8 million in fiscal year 2014. As a percent of revenue, Brick House&#8217;s income from operations increased to 7.1% in the current year from 5.4% in the prior year. This margin improvement is primarily due to the increase in comparable restaurant sales, reduced discounting, and lower general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6828 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6829 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Interest Expense, Net
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6830 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6831 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Interest expense, net increased by $3.8&nbsp;million, or 30.7%, to $16.4 million in 2015 from $12.5 million in 2014, primarily due to the higher average debt balances and interest rates in the current year, partially offset by higher write-offs of debt issuance costs in the prior year. The fiscal 2015 balance includes $1.0 million write-off of debt issuance costs and debt discount compared to $2.2 million write-off of debt issuance costs in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6832 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6833 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Income Tax Expense (Benefit)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6834 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6835 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The income tax expense decreased by $16.5&nbsp;million, or 101.9%, to a $0.3&nbsp;million benefit in fiscal year 2015 from a $16.2&nbsp;million expense in fiscal year 2014 mainly due to an increase of $12.8 million in valuation allowance in 2015 compared to an increase of $25.6 million in 2014. The decrease is also attributable to a&nbsp;higher loss before income taxes in the current year. Excluding the impact of the valuation allowance, the effective income tax rate decreased to 52.1% in fiscal year 2015 from 54.9% in fiscal year 2014 primarily due to the impact of the tax credit carryforwards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6836 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6837 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Discontinued Operations, net
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6838 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6839 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Loss from discontinued operations was $21.5 million for fiscal 2015 compared to $20.2 million for fiscal year 2014. In April 2015, we completed the sale of Macaroni Grill. We recorded a $22.4 million impairment charge during the first quarter of 2015 to write down the net assets of Macaroni Grill to their estimated fair value less cost to sell. During the first quarter of 2015, we also recorded a net gain of $2.1 million on the sale of certain assets of Macaroni Grill and a $1.0 million gain on insurance settlements. During the second quarter of 2015, we recorded a $6.1 million loss on disposal of the Macaroni Grill, which was partially offset by the related tax benefit. The loss from discontinued operations in 2014 relates to the full year operating loss of Macaroni Grill, net of related tax expense, which included impairment charges of $6.3 million for Macaroni Grill&#8217;s goodwill and $0.7 million related to Macaroni Grill&#8217;s long-lived and intangible assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6840 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6841 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
<B>
	Fiscal Year 2014 (52 Weeks) Compared to Fiscal Year 2013 (52 Weeks)
</B>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6842 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6843 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Revenues
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6844 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6845 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenues were $503.5&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2014, an increase of $4.4&nbsp;million, or 0.9%, compared to revenues of $499.2&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2013. The increase is primarily due to higher restaurant count, offset by a 3.5% comparable restaurant sales decrease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6846 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6847 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Revenues at Joe&#8217;s decreased 3.3% to $433.0&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2014 compared to $447.8&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2013. The decrease is primarily caused by a 4.9% decrease in comparable restaurant sales partially offset by sales from new restaurant openings. The comparable restaurant sales decrease is comprised of 6.4% decrease in guest count, offset by a 0.7% increase in pricing and a 0.8% increase in mix. Joe&#8217;s average weekly sales decreased to $61&nbsp;thousand from $65&nbsp;thousand in the prior year. Restaurant operating weeks increased to 7,107 in 2014 from 6,912 in 2013 due to new restaurant openings. We believe the decline in comparable restaurant sales is due partly to our concentrated development in the Northeast region during the past three years that is currently experiencing declining sales as a result of initially high &#8220;honeymoon&#8221; sales and some self-cannibalization from new Joe&#8217;s locations in proximate markets. The nine stores opened in the Northeast during 2011 and 2012 accounted for 41% of the current year comparable sales decline but only represent seven percent of the comparable store base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6848 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6849 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Brick House revenues increased 37.3% to $70.5&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2014 versus $51.4&nbsp;million in fiscal year 2013. The increase was the result of a 7.9% increase in comparable restaurant sales and new restaurant openings. The comparable restaurant sales increase is comprised of a 1.2% increase in pricing and 6.7% increase in combined guest count and mix benefits. Brick House&#8217;s average weekly sales increased to $66&nbsp;thousand from $61&nbsp;thousand in the prior year. Restaurant operating weeks increased to 1,062 in 2014 from 842 in 2013 due to new restaurant openings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4929.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4929 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4929 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4929 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	42
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4929 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA6855 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6856 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Costs of Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6857 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6858 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Cost of sales increased by $9.6 million, or 6.2%, to $163.4 million in 2014 versus $153.8 million in 2013. As a percent of revenue, cost of sales increased to 32.5% from 30.8% primarily due to food cost inflation at the Joe&#8217;s brand. Unusually high shrimp and shellfish costs were the primary drivers of the increase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6859 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6860 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Labor Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6861 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6862 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Labor expenses increased by $5.4 million, or 3.9%, to $142.7 million in 2014 versus $137.3 million in 2013. As a percent of revenue, labor expenses were 28.3% in fiscal year 2014 versus 27.5% in fiscal year 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6863 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6864 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Occupancy Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6865 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6866 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Occupancy expenses increased by $3.9 million, or 11.1%, to $39.4 million in 2014 compared to $35.5 million in 2013. The increase is primarily caused by the increased operating weeks. As a percentage of revenue, occupancy expenses increased to 7.8% from 7.1% primarily due to deleveraging of fixed rent expense from the decrease in comparable restaurant sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6867 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6868 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Other Operating Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6869 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6870 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Other operating expenses increased by $3.4 million, or 3.7%, to $94.1 million in 2014 versus $90.7 million in 2013. This is mainly due to the increase in operating weeks. As a percent of revenue, other operating expenses were 18.7% and 18.2% for 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6871 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6872 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	General and Administrative
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6873 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6874 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	General and administrative expenses decreased by $3.7&nbsp;million, or 8.6%, to $38.7 million in 2014 compared to $42.3 million in 2013. The current year balance included transaction expenses of $0.5 million, while the prior year balance included proposed secondary offering expenses of $0.8 million. As a percent of revenue, excluding the items mentioned above, general and administrative expenses decreased to 7.6% in fiscal year 2014 from 8.3% in fiscal year 2013 due to continued management of our corporate infrastructure costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6876 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6875 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<I>
	Depreciation and Amortization
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6877 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6878 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;Depreciation and amortization expense increased by $2.5&nbsp;million, or 11.6%, to $23.9 million in 2014 versus $21.4 million in 2013. This increase is primarily due to a higher depreciable base from newly opened restaurants. As a percentage of revenue, depreciation and amortization increased to 4.7% in fiscal year 2014 from 4.3% in fiscal year 2013 due to deleveraging from negative same-store sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6879 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6880 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Pre-Opening Costs
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6881 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6882 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Pre-opening costs decreased by $2.0&nbsp;million, or 42.0%, to $2.8 million in 2014 from $4.8 million in 2013. This decrease is mainly due to the timing of scheduled restaurant openings. We opened 4 new restaurants, including 1 conversion, in 2014 and 14 new restaurants, including 5 conversions, in 2013. We also incurred pre-opening costs in both years for restaurants opened in the subsequent fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6883 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6884 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Asset Impairments and Closures
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6885 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6886 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Asset impairments and closures increased to $2.0&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2014 from $0.2&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2013. The $1.8 million increase is mainly due to the current year impairment charge for one Joe&#8217;s restaurant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6887 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4930 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4930 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4930 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	43
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR4930 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4930.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6895 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We periodically evaluate possible impairment of our intangible assets, as well as other fixed assets at the individual restaurant-level, and record an impairment loss whenever we determine that the fair value of these assets is less than their carrying value. We also periodically evaluate the criteria we use as an indication of asset impairment. As a result of our annual impairment testing, we recorded an impairment charge of $1.8 million in fiscal year 2014 related to Joe&#8217;s long-lived assets. If we are unable to improve the performance of our restaurants or if we experience deteriorating results at some of our restaurants, we could recognize additional impairment charges. The closure-related expenses for fiscal year 2014 were primarily comprised of future minimum lease obligations, net of any related estimated sublease income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6896 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6897 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Loss on Disposal of Assets
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6898 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6899 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Loss on disposal of assets decreased by $0.7&nbsp;million, or 35.2%, to $1.3&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2014 from $2.1&nbsp;million for fiscal year 2013. The loss in fiscal year 2014 primarily relates to the impact of writing off $1.2 million in book value of replaced restaurant equipment and facilities improvements. The loss in fiscal year 2013 was primarily due to $0.7&nbsp;million in asset retirement losses for closed, converted and remodeled restaurants, and $1.4&nbsp;million write-off in book value of replaced restaurant equipment and facilities improvements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6900 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6901 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Income (Loss) from Operations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6902 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6903 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As a result of the foregoing, consolidated income from operations decreased by $15.8 million, or 142.9%, to a $4.7 million loss in fiscal year 2014 from an $11.1 million income in fiscal year 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6904 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6905 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Joe&#8217;s income from operations decreased by $24.2 million, or 53.0%, to $21.5 million in fiscal year 2014 from $45.6 million in fiscal year 2013. As a percent of revenue, excluding the impact of non-cash impairment charges, income from operations for Joe&#8217;s decreased to 5.4% in the current year from 10.2% in the prior year. This decrease is primarily attributable to lower comparable restaurant sales, food cost inflation and deleveraging of fixed costs against lower sales volume.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6906 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6907 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Income from operations for Brick House increased by $2.6 million, or 219.8%, to $3.8 million in fiscal year 2014 from $1.2 million in fiscal year 2013. As a percent of revenue, Brick House&#8217;s income from operations increased to 5.4% in the current year from 2.3% in the prior year. This margin improvement is primarily due to the increase in comparable restaurant sales and the higher operating weeks resulting from the increased restaurant count.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6909 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6908 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<I>
	Interest Expense, Net
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6910 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6911 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;Interest expense, net increased by $7.3&nbsp;million, or 138.7%, to $12.5 million in 2014 from $5.2 million in 2013, primarily due to the higher average debt balances and interest rates as well as an increase in write-offs of debt issuance costs related to refinancing and debt repayment transactions. The fiscal 2014 balance includes $2.2 million in debt issuance costs write-off compared to $0.5 million in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6912 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6913 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Gain (Loss) on Insurance Settlements
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6914 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6915 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The gain on insurance settlements during fiscal years 2014 and 2013 represents insurance recovery on losses recognized in 2012 caused by Hurricane Sandy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6916 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6917 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 54PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Income Tax Expense (Benefit)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6918 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6919 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The income tax expense increased by $17.1&nbsp;million to a $16.2&nbsp;million expense in fiscal year 2014 from a $0.9&nbsp;million benefit in fiscal year 2013 mainly due to the impact of the $25.6 million valuation allowance, offset partially by the loss before income taxes in fiscal year 2014. Excluding the impact of the valuation allowance, the effective income tax rate was 54.9% in fiscal year 2014 compared to (12.5%) in fiscal year 2013 primarily due to the impact of the tax credit carryforwards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4931.1 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK4931 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR4931 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM4931 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	44
